comment.text:
Great experience here! We have been to other locations but the west midtown one is the best. The staff here are just great, walking in we were greeted with energy. Nothing better than already feeling welcome. The wait staff came to check up on us even though you order through your phone it just felt like we were VIP. Ordering on the phone is hard for people who are not great with tech (me) but they helped immediately. Parking is tough they do have a public parking deck down the street that was $2 for two hours. 

Food wise always satisfied! We got the trio with salsas and guacamole. It didn't come with enough chips, but they brought more out! 

The tacos, I always get the fried oyster you can't go wrong with it. My fiancé liked the tuna taco but wish it was on a corn or flour tortilla (maybe it can be subbed out) the birria tacos were sooooo juicy. The side sauce was more of a thick soup vs. what birria comes with typically needless to say it still had all the flavors that you would expect.

These tacos are literally heaven on earth. I inhaled them in the car! Toooooo freaking good. Every location is good but this one specifically took it to a different level. The flavor packed a punch that sent me into a food daze ‍ in the best way possible. I wish there was a location closer to me. They're so good that I'm willing to make the drive though.

I came to bartaco on a beautiful sunny day. It was perfect weather to sit outdoors, but unfortunately they were busy cleaning the patio. This wasn't a big deal because the indoor seating was comfortable. Also, the operable walls were open and let in the fresh air. The ambiance is relaxed, trendy, and vibrant with a casual coastal vibe. The design of the restaurant, with its open and airy layout, creates an inviting atmosphere that is perfect for socializing and casual dining. Service was great and the waiters were all very friendly, attentive and helpful. You place your meal through QR code menu ordering, which requires you to put in your payment information. The food comes out shortly after. Below are my reviews:

* Seared chorizo taco - This is an argentinian-style spiced ground pork, topped with sweet onion, cilantro and smoky red chimichurri sauce that comes on a 4-inch corn tortilla. You only get a few pieces of meat, but it is so tasty and tender. The flavor tastes even better after you squeeze a bit of lime juice on it. Definitely worth getting again!
* Glazed pork belly taco - The pork belly is soft and tender. It is supposedly marinated in a spicy arbol chili sauce, but what I tasted was the sweet caramelized flavor of the glaze. Like the chorizo taco, this came on a corn tortilla. This was delicious, but I think I like the chorizo even more. 
* Tuna tatako taco - This is an ancho-crusted tuna with asian slaw on a bibb lettuce shell. I didn't know what to expect, but I was pleasantly surprised by the flavor of this taco and the presentation. The tuna is coated in what tastes like a sweet soy sauce. The asian slaw is also well-seasoned and the flavors come together nicely. It tastes healthy and refreshing, especially after you add a few drops of lime juice. I will say that the tuna isn't super fresh, but it still tastes good.

* Oaxacan sunshine - Absolutely adored this cocktail! The passion fruit flavor really hit the spot, and all the ingredients complement each other. It is so refreshing and the alcohol is not overpowering. This is a really well made cocktail and I have to learn how to make this myself because it is just that good. (Ingredients: libélula joven + gentian liqueur + orange + mint + lime + passionfruit syrup + chia + montelobos mezcal mist)
* Spring caipirinha - This cocktail was not as impressive as the oaxacan. I expected it to taste more tart because of the elderflower, but it ended up tasting like diluted, spiked, fresh orange juice. It wasn't bad, but I would go for the oaxacan if you are looking for something citrusy/sour, that is also sweet and refreshing. (Ingredients: cachaça 51 + elderflower + orange + lime + sugar). 

While I think this place is a bit pricey considering the small portions, the food is tasty. I would love to come back and try more off the menu!

photos.caption: Guac w/ Chips (pictured only 2 chips but comes with 4)
(left to right) Seared Chorizo Taco, Glazed Pork Belly Taco

comment.text: This spot literally hit the spot! So goood! I probably ordered one of everything and it was so worth it. Marshawn was really knowledgeable of the menu and helped me make some great choices! Loving the hospitality here and will certainly return whenever I'm back in town!

We come to Howell Mill location a few times a year. 

One thing that is different about this restaurant is you need to place your order on the app by scanning the code affixed to the table. The servers are there only to bring the food/drinks and to clear the tables. There is no usual chattiness or attention unless you flag someone down. They have little cards that you are supposed to prop up when you need service, but no one really pays attention to those. 

They also do not take reservations but if you have their app on your phone, you can add yourself to a wait list that starts ticking off 30 minutes for you to show up to the restaurant. This does not guarantee you a table though.

Now to the positives: the food is good and so are the drinks. I love their brown rice bowls and the steak tacos. The salsa trio is super salty, so I won't order it since it always disappoints. The patio is nice in summer but sometimes the music is very loud and it's hard to communicate.

Overall: parking may be tricky (street parking is usually hard to find but I do believe they have valet), nice patio, good food and drinks, spotty service. Your make the call ;)

owner_replies.comment:
Hi there! Thank you so much for this review! We are working hard on improving the quality of our service and feedback like yours is what help us! I would love to hear more, please feel free to reach out at ahouy@bartaco.com. 

Thank you! - Angele Houy

comment.text: Overall our experience was good. The service is usually quick and the food is good. The ambiance has a friendly bar vibe.

owner_replies.comment: Hi, Phoenix! Thank you so much for visiting us and for this great review! Please feel free to let us know how we can improve your experience to 5-stars next time around. We look forward to serving you again and are grateful that you took the time to leave us a review.

comment.text:
The name itself says it all on what you need to order.  Tacos.  It's street taco so it's the smaller tacos so make sure to get a few if you're hungry.  We had several tacos and they were all very good. Each has its own flavor profile which I greatly appreciate. We especially enjoyed the duck barria tacos. The duck and cheese had great flavor and the tacos were crunchy. The sauce to dunk the tacos was good. Very delicious.  

We had some of their cocktails: margarita, mojitos which were good.  

Only negative is the limited parking as there's none. You're stuck with finding parking on the street. The parking lot next door is only for those in that shopping center. 

It's mobile ordering and you can have it in one receipt or per person.  Thus, make sure you have your phone and a card on file for your phone. 

Otherwise, it's still a great restaurant with nice ambiance.
Tacos has become a favorite of mine. I love variety and bartaco has great options. Definitely try this spot if you haven't yet.

I can't tell you all how much I go here within a week because it's insane. So you should come too. Service is always fast and I'm highly addicted to the oyster tacos and the old thymer, they shake it to smooth perfection.

My friends and I came here because it was one of the few restaurants whose kitchen was still open and we were all wanting to eat something and grab some more drinks! Coming here late night was a great choice, everyone was just trying to have a good time and the servers were all super friendly. I had the salsa verde chicken tacos and chorizo taco and we ordered chips and guac for the table. I like that for their chips they use whole tortillas! That's pretty unique. Their guac is also really flavorful and fresh. My favorite part of bartaco is the bar part of it haha, their drinks are excellent! I highly recommend the winter caipirinha, the presentation was beautiful and it was just super tasty! 
Now that I know their kitchen is open late, I think I will be coming here more often. My only complaint is the parking, there were no spots in the garage and I ended up parking in the Food Terminal Lot, which I'm not sure if I was allowed to do
Food is always great! Customer service is on point work friendly staff. The ambience and music is great for a mid-day lunch or a late night rendezvous! Would definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Oyster, Ribeye, Duck, and Pork belly tacos and a green margarita

comment.text:
The ambience is chill, the atmosphere is inviting and the service is well done. As for the tacos...because that's what you came for...wait a minute let's talk about the street corn. It was delicious! Now tacos...they were very good, very small and can goo or it down in a few bites but full of flavor. My favorite was the duck! As a shrimp lover I went all in with the shrimp tacos but they were disappointing. They chef almost did too much to them
So the flavor over powered the shrimp. I don't recommend them. But would recommend all of the other tacos. Enjoy my friends.

It's been a few years since I've come downtown to enjoy Bartaco, but when a friend comes to town for a trade show and is staying near CNN center, it's time to revisit an old favorite!  And it's just as good as I remember it!!  My friend and I started with margaritas and guacamole and each ordered a handful of tacos. I stuck with the basics, where she went for the wilder tacos and we both enjoyed our meals!  Ordering is now a little bit different, it's done with a QR code on your phone, but is really easy to combine or split up checks at the end!  And the food is still incredible!

photos.caption: What's left of our guacamole when we remembered to take photos and a couple of margaritas!

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Christine,

Congrats on the new job and thank you for the awesome review.  Hope to see you soon!!!

Art

comment.text:
This is "the spot" it seems like, because the wait to get a table for two was close to an hour - on a weeknight. Came with a friend of mine. I like how you order on the app and they bring you your orders and you pay right in there. 

Everything was so tasty! If I'm ever in the area again, I'll definitely have to hit them up.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Nellie! Thank you for leaving us your feedback. We are so sorry about the wait for that table! But I am glad to hear you had a great experience! I would love to know how we could have made your experiemce a better one! You can email me ahouy@bartaco.com
Thank you!

comment.text: Walked in on whim with my husband and two little ones, and we were not disappointed at all! The food was absolutely delicious especially the glazed pork belly tacos 10 out of 10!!! but the service! the service was outstanding!!!!! Tylar went above and beyond to accommodate my little one in a stroller, she continuously came around making sure we had everything we needed, she treated us like family, made us feel welcomed. We will definitely be back soon. Thank you Tylar for taking pride at what you do at bartaco.

I've been to Bartaco a few times in the past, but I haven't been in awhile. I got a chance to dine there on Tuesday with some friends. Prior to going, I called ahead and we were able to join the waitlist. When we arrived, our table was ready and we were seated right away. Now a few things have changed since I was last there like the ordering process. They have a QR scan code on the table and everything is ordered and paid for by phone. This is definitely convenient and more COVID safe, but the way things came out, especially with a party of 9, was a little confusing. Some people ordered the same items, so it was hard to tell whose food was coming out. It would be nice if they called the name with the order, I think that would help. 

Our table ordered a variety of food and drink items off the menu. The guacamole and chips, Baja fish tacos, pork belly taco, Esquites (Mexican street corn off the cob), and the spiced chicken verde taco were among the favorites. We also ordered salsa roja and chips, crispy oysters and chili-lime shrimp tacos. I personally liked the crispy oysters taco. It was very flavorful and tasty. The chili-lime shrimp taco was good, but definitely super spicy. Some guests couldn't even finish it due to the spice level, so beware. For drinks, we ordered a hibiscus mezcalita, an old thymer, margaritas, and other drinks. For some reason, it took forever for some of our drinks to come out, but once we got them, the drinks were all really good!

Overall, our dining experience was good with some minor kinks. However, I plan to visit again in the future and hopefully the ordering issues will be worked out. Bartaco is good spot for a quick bite to eat and drink. Definitely check this place out if you're in the area!

photos.caption: (L-R: Spiced Chicken Verde, Crispy Oysters, Chili-Lime Shrimp x2)
Esquites (Mexican street corn off the cob)

comment.text:
The food was good.  I had the duck tacos which to my surprise was QUACKING- literally delicious! The drinks were subpar. I had the pomegranate lemonade- wouldn't recommend.  The atmosphere was a nice vibe.  The music had me moving and grooving while I indulged in a tasty meal.  

Sharon was a great waiter and hostess.  She engaged in conversation and was on time and catered to my needs as a great host would.  

I would highly recommend this place!

Really cool venue with a lot of fun places to explore before and after your meal! It's surrounded by restaurants and activity themed places too! The bar service was a bit chilly but it's holiday season so I'm sure they are exhausted. 

We came in for drinks primarily. The sangria is delicious. It's not the strongest, but if you are looking for a light cocktail choose this one! The mojito is so sour, fresh and good! One of my favorites!

I also tried the corn appetizer. It was great. Very warm and salty from the feta. You have to be a feta lover to love this appetizer! Salsa verde also is very good! All pretty small portions I must say.

The tacos could be bigger but the meat was great.
The drinks were good and the staff was nice.

Very good but very small. You have to order on your phone and through the app. The servers are very friendly and the food is quick to come. There is usually a long wait but come early in the afternoon. I obviously got my tacos on a lettuce wrap and it was delicious. Depends on your appetite I would say to order at least 3. The waitress warned me but I didn't listen. Fool me once.

Came in with Baby Love on a Thursday night around 9PM. Once seated, you scan the QR code on the table for the menu. First scan wouldn't let us order, only view the menu. 2nd attempt it wouldn't go through because it froze several times when it got to the credit card portion. Ended up doing a paper order after tracking a server down. Write the drinks up top and added special instructions at the bottom. "NO DAIRY" in all caps. 

For the restaurant not to be busy, the service was really slow. We patiently wait for something ordered to come out. Our drinks are first, very delicious. I ordered a Spicy Margarita. 

My salad comes next. Very good! Same for the guac and chips that finally arrived. Quite some time later, our tacos came out. Woot woot! We ordered portobello, falafel and cauliflower. Two of those needed to be altered because we requested no dairy. Just looking at them, our request was ignored. We asked the waitress to confirm, to which she replied "they all got dairy". Errr....so we send them back to try again. Back to the extreme wait time with this half empty restaurant. We decided to go ahead and cancel the request. Enough of the shenanigans for one night, refunded for the tacos and left. 
I've been to all of the Bartacos in the area and this is the first where the customer service was below sub par. Probably won't be back to this location.

Literally the best things on the menu in my opinion... the duck bowl and chicken taco has never missed and I've been coming to bar taco for years ..if you like duck you will not be disappointed I like to top mine with the verde salsa .. for me it just takes it to another level ... Porsha was my bartender today and she was a vibe!!!! I go a lot of places solo so it always helps when the bartender is welcoming... the drinks are really good too !

Cute restaurant I had the pleasure of trying with my coworkers. I love that you can order every thing individually and it comes out on trays making it easy for everyone to try everything. We raved about the plantains and guac for the appetizers. We tried a lot of the tacos and the fan favorites were the Baja fish, sesame ribeye and the duck. I didn't particularly love my sangria but the margaritas good according to my co workers. We sat on the patio on a Friday and it wasn't too busy at all, good vibes.

photos.caption: Plantains Guac Roja Verde w/ Chips Grilled Corn

owner_replies.comment:
Hello Krystal,
First of all I want to thank you and your friends for dining with us. I very happy you enjoyed our tacos. I understand the sangria did not hit the spot. We will take this feedback and see if we can’t hit the spot on your next visit. I can’t wait for you and your friends to return and give bartaco and maybe our margarita another shot!

comment.text:
Food was delicious!! This is our  1st time visiting Atlanta, my Husband & I we're looking for some tacos, & let me start by saying , fast service, drinks are great ( pineapple crunch) my favorite  I had the Chile-lime shrimp Taco ,, just loved the food.. but last & not least big shout out to the manager Natasha!!! She was a sweetheart, friendly, she just a doll..  I'll definitely recommend this place  Thank you again Natasha for your hospitality & your hugs  



The atmosphere was so welcoming

I'm gonna keep this review short and simple.... DON'T GO!  food - disgusting. 
Parking - limited (if any)
Staff - inattentive. 

DON'T GO!

Came here on a Friday evening before an activity and was SUPER excited to try the much talked about Bar Taco, unfortunately I was extremely let down..

I give it 3 stars for the service and atmosphere. When I came in, there was no wait and we were seated quickly which was a pleasant surprise since I've read reviews about how busy they could get! The ambiance was nice, they were playing a little bit of Drake and Beyoncé at a comfortable level and it was nice looking at the different pictures they had on the walls. I bet it looks even nicer during the day. 

The manager and another waiter stopped by several times to ask if we had any questions about the ordering process since you order via QR code. PLEASEEE remember to close out your tab at the end, because it can be very tricky to know there's a next step to close out the tab. 

For a drink, I got the summer caipirinha which tasted heavily like lime but I liked it. Wasn't super strong and tasted good. 

To eat, I got the Fried Oyster Tacos and Sesame Ribeye. This is where the disappointment honestly set in. When they arrived to the table, they were much smaller than expected which was fine since I wasn't starving but it kind of caught me off guard. I took one bite of the sesame ribeye taco and declined to eat the rest.. it was dry (both the taco and the meat), cold, and the sesame flavor did not rock my tastebuds with Asian flavor like I was hoping it would. That taco gets a 0/10 from me. The fried oyster taco had a better flavor.. the remoulade tasted like tartar and complimented it well and the oysters had a nice, airy batter to them. However, they were EXTREMELY chewy. I am not exaggerating when I say I was chewing each oyster for at least 10 minutes.. I was with company and didn't want to be rude and spit it out but it gave my jaw a full workout when I just wanted to enjoy my meal. For that reason, that taco gets a 4/10. My friend had the duck taco and gave it a 5/10 due to lack of flavor. 

Overall, the ambiance was good but I don't think I'd ever be back. The food really missed the mark for me.

photos.caption: L: Crispy Oyster Taco R: Sesame Ribye

owner_replies.comment: I apologize, if possible please reach out to me via email at rmartin@bartaco.com. so that we may discuss how I can further rectify this for you.

comment.text:
3.5 stars. The ordering system is confusing and frustrating even for me and I'm in my early twenties; I can't imagine how it is for older people lol. Everything is done from a QR code and it just takes so much longer to order and makes it difficult to customize orders. 

We got chips and salsa, several different kinds of tacos, rice and beans, the chocolate gelato, and a beer and a margarita. 

The margarita was really good and fresh and not too sweet. I also don't think it was strong but it was worth it. 

The chips and salsa were interesting. The "chips" were round tortilla shells essentially that you had to break up yourself. Ehh. The salsa wasn't great in my opinion, it had a very smoky flavor that i wasn't a huge fan of. 

The tacos were pretty good. The chicken one was the best. Shrimp one wasn't great. The fish one was pretty good. 

The rice was very bland by itself but the beans were super flavorful and made the rice better once you added them in. 

The chocolate gelato was great. 

It was kind of expensive

photos.caption: chips and Salsa Roja w/ Chips

comment.text:
Bartaco has been on my list of restaurants to visit for a while now and I finally made it in. Was had a party of 7 but a few people were running behind. They sat us with no issue and advised on their ordering process. They had a QR code on the table which takes you to the website for you to order your food and pay when you're ready to checkout. The food and drinks came out very quickly. The ability to order when we wanted was very helpful especially since we had a large group. 

I ordered the street corn, plantains, and 2 tacos (falafel and shrimp). All of the food was amazing! I was pleasantly surprised that the plantains were so delicious. We ended up placing a second order for more.  There were a few other items on the menu I wanted to try so I would definitely be going back.

We finally made it out to bartaco and it was YUM. bartaco has very very limited parking in the lot by their restaurant with maybe 4 spots. We luckily parked on the street behind bartaco and only paid ~$3 for parking for our time out at dinner and there's a little stairway right by bartaco to go back.

The atmosphere and decor of bartaco was sooooooo cute and this can definitely be a cute date night out place or a girl's night out. Even though a ton of reviews said there's normally a wait, we walked right in on a Saturday night with a good 1/3 of tables still empty. I do like bartaco's digital concept as you place your order on your phone via QR code, add items as you please, and pay from your phone as well. Just easy peasy!

We ordered:
- Baja Fish Tacos ($2.85)
- Spiced Chicken Verde Taco ($2.85)
- Crispy Oyster Taco ($3.85)
- Sesame Ribeye Taco ($3.85)
- Glazed Pork Belly Taco ($3.85)
- Roasted Duck Taco ($3.85)
- Street Corn ($3) 

We enjoyed all of our tacos we ordered, but they are a bit smaller than your 'average' tacos as they were more street taco sized. Normally 3 normal size tacos are enough for me, but after eating our first three we had to get another. My partner is not normally a fan of corn tortillas, but he did like these!

The Baja Fish taco had a light yet crispy batter and the fish flaked perfectly. The Spiced Chicken Verde taco I found kinda meh-average, but my partner liked this one more. The Crispy Oyster taco was super yummy as well with a nice batter, but it came with only 2 pieces of fried oysters that left some taco bare with no protein. The Sesame Ribeye taco had a heaping serving of meat with a nice umami flavor. The Glazed Pork Belly taco can also get dinged for the amount of protein inside. Lastly, we both agreed the Roasted Duck taco was a HIT. We both enjoyed this one a lot and it's my partner's favorite of the night while my favorite was the Sesame Ribeye. The Street Corn was alright, but I don't think I would get it again.

After tax and tip, dinner for 2 people came out to be around $40 which is pretty good for a Saturday night dinner in West Midtown! We'll most definitely be back for these tacos and the ambience!

This was my first dine in visit after enjoying takeout a couple of weeks before.  The restaurant is located downtown but fortunately there's a parking garage with free parking almost next door.  Sunday around 1pm 
we were seated right away and asked if it was our first time. I quickly found out why.  Things are done differently here with little to no contact between guests and servers so a tutorial from the staff the first time is very helpful.  Quests use their smartphones to scan a small QR code attached to the middle of the table that takes you to the digital menu. Then they place their orders through the site which is routed directly to the kitchen. And when done eating diners pay for their meal. If you need a server's attention you simply put the dragonfly card provided in the small metal tabletop cardholder.  
We started with chips and salsa roja/$3.25. It was too spicy for me so they brought out a mild salsa verde and more chips at no charge.  We also had street corn(2)/$3.50; glazed pork belly rice bowl/$9.95 and a roasted duck taco/$3.85. The food was fresh with bold flavors and very tasty.  
I will absolutely be a repeat customer.

photos.caption: Salsa Verde w/ Chips, Salsa Roja w/ Chips

comment.text:
Went here with 2 friends a couple months ago and we all left disappointed. Mainly because of the super long wait for every step of the process (getting a table, ordering, getting our food, getting our dessert, and even getting the check). I think it took over 2 hours total.

The tacos are extremely pricey for their portion size. The best one was probably the baja fish - lightly battered and fish was pleasantly flaky. The duck was questionable and tasted off. The sesame ribeye was decent.

The churros were not as good as Costco's churro...

Will not return again.

photos.caption: Sesame Ribeye Taco, Roasted Duck Taco, Baja Fish Taco
Roasted Duck Taco, Baja Fish Taco

comment.text:
Tacos were great, service could have been a bit tighter. The place wasn't full but we were told it would be a 30 minute wait for 3 people. We then asked if we could sit at the bar and the host said "if you can dine a seat" We found 3 quickly!

We had the cauliflower, Baja, and shrimp tacos. All were delicious! We also had some margaritas and the house tequila cocktail. 

We ordered and my drink never came out, finally we asked the bartender and she said she'd make it right away. It still took another few for it to come out but when it did it was really yummy. We also ordered a second round of tacos after our first. This round came without one taco. We told a bartender who said they'd check on it for us.

We then asked again a few minutes later and she said "oh we can remove it since you didn't get it" and I had to ask, like can I still get the taco haha?  

Overall yummy food and drinks. Ended up being ~$200 for three people (two drinks each, 3-5 tacos each + some guacamole as a side). Staff weren't super quick and seemed frazzled so don't come if you're in a hurry.

There are so many locations these days. I love the Marietta Street location because I'm an ITP girl.  The menu is pretty simple. The pork belly taco is my fav and the street corn is amazing. Love the drinks. They have a unique service concept where you order your own food on your phone. I love it personally! The food comes out at a nice pace...I love it!

ELOTE ELOTE ELOTE
Plantains
empanada if you have them
hot n spicy 
Baja Fish Taco
Chorizo Taco
Falafel Taco
Ribeye Tacos
Salsa Verde W/ Chips
Shrimp Tacos
pork Belly
Curry Shrimp
want to try them all
i know they're good
it's hard to be a vegan with a menu like this LOL

I was in the area so I stopped by for my fav margarita & sweet plantains appetizers. The dipping sauce that comes with the plantain gives it a very nice kick. I enjoy the option of cashless and the food comes out very quickly. The staff is very friendly and the drinks are really good!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for this amazing review! I would love to hear more and see how we could have made your experience an even better one. Thank you! -Angele Houy

comment.text: Everything is great! We have been serval times in several locations and it's always good. I really like ordering anything we need from my phone & it comes out fast and wonderful,

This was our 2nd visit here. This was actually our last date a week before the world shut down. Last year this place on on and popping. Food was amazing.....this year food was subpar and service was trash. This new scanning thing to order did not work on our table because apparently the people before skipped paying and it was a whole ordeal to clear it so we could order. They had to bring out pens and paper and they only gave us one. We bother wanted some of the same tacos but prepared differently which confused the server. Dude you should have giving up 2 separate ordering sheets. It was all just to much and it left a bad taste in our mouths. 
Probably never going back. 
We had high hopes.

photos.caption: Duck Tacos with lettuce wrap  Mojo Pork Carnitas Steamed Brown Rice

comment.text: Food was bland, nothing special compared to the reviews that really seem to hype this place up.

owner_replies.comment:
Good afternoon!
My name is Chris and I am the Assistant General Manager for bartaco at West Midtown. Thank you for reaching out and providing us with feedback from your most recent visit to our location. I apologize for the quality of the food that you received. The philosophy of our menu is to always provide fresh and flavorful options for our guest and we are incredibly disappointed that your food did not meet our standard. I would love to invite you back for a Dinner for 2 on us to make up for this experience and to show what bartaco has to offer. Please feel free to reach out to me directly at cwendt@bartaco.com to discuss further. I look forward to hearing from you soon!
- Chris Wendt

comment.text:
Dined in (outside) on a Wednesday evening - and even then it was incredibly packed already. We seated outside which was on a cute back patio.

You order through the website that you can get to via the QR code on your table. I will say this was the least enjoyable part of my experience since it was very buggy and laggy. You have to put in your phone number to validate yourself, but the system took about 5-10 minutes to even send the code for validation. Ordering was fine, though no feedback if your order actually went through or not - you just kind of had to hope that it did. A few tacos never ended up making it to the table by the end and our poor waiter had to pester the kitchen to make them for us. There were also issues with the billing on the site: some receipts got switched around and some individual items got moved to other people's receipts. We all ended up having to get our orders billed manually via our waiter, which seems to defeat the purpose of having this online system.

I will say our waiter was incredible and handled everything very well, especially amongst the chaos of the busy restaurant. Every single taco was delicious (I got the Baja Fish, Pork Belly, Mojo Pork Carnitas, Crispy Oyster, Sesame Ribeye, and the #bartacosecret Barbacoa). My favorites are for sure the crispy oyster and the pork belly! I also got a side of plantains which were great - especially the sauce that came with it - which was kind of like a ranch/mayo. Definitely get the plantains to round out your meal if you can't fill up on just tacos alone.

Overall - the service was great and the food was even better. Get there early to try to beat the crowd since it's a popular place. If you don't have a lot of time, I would probably try their takeout stand, since the ordering system may take up some extra time.

photos.caption: Plantains, crispy oyster taco, brisket barbacoa taco, Baja Fish Tacos

comment.text: It was a great first experience at this location. It was an interesting experience. You start out by scanning a qr code to bring up the menu. Everything this done on your phone. The time between ordering and receiving you food was minimal even with place being packed. All the food was tasty and exactly as ordered. Great experience. It is must try location, you will not be disappointed

photos.caption: Baja Fish Tacos and Fish Tacos

comment.text: Consistently great every time. The drinks never disappoint and I haven't had a bad taco yet. The app system is super convenient and even if they're busy and the service can't be as quick the staff is always attentive and personable. If we've ever had an issue they resolve quickly . If you go on the evening or on the weekends there may be a wait but the bar usually has seating. ORDER THE FISH TACO. You're welcome.

Came here for dinner while out with a friend. I ordered a brown rice bowl with pork belly. It was delicious as usual and consistent with the other bartaco locations. The only con is parking is a pain at this location. I'd go back but i'd mentally prepare to be looking a while for parking.

I hadn't been to bartaco since precovid and was very impressed how well they abided by covid guidelines. The tables are far apart with plastic dividers and you don't even come into contact with a waiter. You order everything through your phone and it quickly comes out.

The food itself is always great. The tacos are a bit on the smaller side, but the taste makes up for it. I'm also a huge fan of their guac and plaintains too.

photos.caption: Fried Oyster Taco, Portobello Taco, Pork Belly Taco
Kids Kids Sesame Beef Taco with and Cheese

comment.text: I reserved space for 40 people a week before my date. The day of 6/13/23, I called and spoke to the manager, Thomas. He was unaware of the large crowd but quickly prepared his staff for my party. They greeted us with great energy. Thomas and the servers were attentive and sociable. I will be visiting again, even if it's by myself. Thank you Bartaco!

Always a solid meal and good atmosphere if you are out and about in Atlanta. I was annoyed to be carded twice, I clearly don't look that young. It's just a note that a process shouldn't triumph common sense.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Myshell!  My name is Dan Conway, and I am the Assistant GM here at bartaco West Midtown.  I wanted to reach out to thank you for your feedback as we appreciate hearing how our guests are responding to our operations.  I would like to apologize for the inconvenience of having to be carded more than once. Georgia law does require the person serving the alcohol to ask for ID prior to serving a beverage to anyone that looks like they may be under 40.  (I think it may have been a compliment).  Again, I apologize for the inconvenience, but I encourage you to reach out to me if you would like to discuss further.  I can be reached at dconway@bartaco.com.  I look forward to hearing from you!

Sincerely,
Dan Conway

comment.text: Very nice, I like the menu selection, size of the restaurant and the ability to order direct from my phone to keep my food and drinks coming . Very convenient. I also saw one of my favorite actors from Ruthless here !!!!

I REALLY enjoyed the atmosphere and food AND drinks! The staff is super friendly. Feel like friends. I'm not sure if they'll start serving the Mango Chamoy Margarita year round but if it's available...GET IT! So tasty. I ended up getting a variety of tacos because who doesn't live tacos and who doesn't love options?! Crispy oyster, Baja fish, sesame ribeye, and spiced chicken verde. They were all so yummy. My favorite....probably the chicken. I ended it all with churros. I wasn't as happy with those. Not as sweet as I'd like and the chocolate dipping sauce wasn't my thing. I thought I'd enjoy more. But when I'm back in ATL I'll surely swing back through. 

Oh! And the duck quesadilla wasn't too bad. And if you're a fan of guacamole then don't pass up on it. I'm a guac lover and I enjoyed.

I said I'd come back for the duck and I DID! Very nice wednes-date. The only thing I would add to my previous review is try the barria starter it was delicious and definitely the star of my second trip here.

photos.caption: Fish, chicken, shrimp, pork in no particular order

comment.text:
The food here is amazing, as well as affordable. We had mushroom, oyster, and fish tacos (favorite to least favorite). The guacamole is the best I've ever had. The margaritas here are awesome as well. 

The service this visit was not the best. There was no host at the post , we waited about five minutes before someone approached our party. The food took a long time to come out once ordered. 

The ambience here is good, we sat out on the patio, equipped with heaters if the temperature drops. We parked at a nearby garage (free). 

I love bartaco's food ; however, the service made it a leas desirable experience.

photos.caption: Baja Fish Tacos and mushroom tacos

comment.text: Bartaco was one of the first palaces I came to when I moved to Atlanta, definitely a cute spot. Like sitting on the patio and having a marg. Make sure to try the duck tacos, very good. Service is quick but the last couple of times I've gone the digital system was down.
